Element.Name: Specification identification
Element.Description: Identifies the specification of content and rules that apply to the transaction.

Element.Name: Business process type identifier
Element.Description: Identifies the BII profile or business process context in which the transaction appears.

Element.Name: Document identifier
Element.Description: The identity of the Receipt Advice set by the sender. It must be a unique identity. The Identity together with the Issue Date and Issue Time gives the version of the Receipt Advice.

Element.Name: Dispatch advice issue date
Element.Description: The date when the despatch advice is issued. Format = "YYYY-MM-DD"

Element.Name: Dispatch advice issue time
Element.Description: The time when the receipt advice is issued. Format = "HH:MM:SS+timezone". Timezone is optional to use. If omitted, the local timezone where the document was issued should be assumed.

Element.Name: Receipt advice status code
Element.Description: A code signifying the status of the Receipt Advice. Default is Original (9)

Element.Name: Receipt advice type code
Element.Description: A code signifying the type of the Receipt Advice - Response to the Advanced Despatch Advice (D) or Response to the received Shipment (S).

Element.Name: Dispatch note
Element.Description: A textual note for the delivery as whole.

Element.Name: Order reference information
Element.Description: A reference to the original order

Element.Name: Order reference
Element.Description: Used to provide a reference to the order on which the despatch is based.

Element.Name: Despatch Document Reference
Element.Description: A reference to the Advanced Despatch Advice.

Element.Name: Identity of the Despatch Document.
Element.Description: The ID of the Advanced Despatch Advice. The unique identity of the Advanced Despatch Advice is made up by ID, IssueDate and IssueTime in combination.

Element.Name: Issue Date
Element.Description: The date the Advanced Despatch Advice was issued.

Element.Name: The time the Advanced Despatch Advice was issued.
Element.Description: The time when the Advanced Despatch Advice was issued. Format = "HH:MM:SS+timezone". Timezone is optional to use. If omitted, the local timezone where the document was issued should be assumed.

Element.Name: Document Status Code
Element.Description: To be used when the Receipt Advice is a response to the received Advanced Despatch Advice. The status Code describes whether the Advanced Despatch Advice is accepted or if it is rejected due to errors, and the supplier should send a new.

Element.Name: Document Description
Element.Description: Text to describe the reason for the rejection.

Element.Name: Additional document reference
Element.Description: Reference to additional documents relevant for this Receipt advice. Can be used for additional BEAst information on header level.

Element.Name: Identity of the reference
Element.Description: The reference number of added document

Element.Name: Document type code
Element.Description: The type of reference. Must me part of UNCL1001. At least one of Document Type Code and Document Type must be used.

Element.Name: Document type
Element.Description: The type of reference that cannot be specified by a code. At least one of Document Type Code and Document Type must be used.

Element.Name: Attachment
Element.Description: Group to describe an attached document. An attachment can refer to an external document or be included with the document being exchanged.

Element.Name: Embedded binary object
Element.Description: The referenced document can here be inserted as a binary object.

Attribute.Name: Attached document Mime code
Attribute.Description: The mime code of the attached document.

Attribute.Name: Attached document filename
Attribute.Description: The file name of the attached document

Element.Name: External reference
Element.Description: A reference to an attached document that is external to the document(s) being exchanged.

Element.Name: Address to internet resource
Element.Description: The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that identifies the external object as an Internet resource.

Element.Name: Consignee information
Element.Description: The Consignee is the person or organization to which the products will be or has been shipped and who is taking possession. It also defines the sender of the Receipt Advice. The role is carried out by the customer or on behalf of the customer.

Element.Name: Consignee party electronic address
Element.Description: Identifies the consignee party's electronic address

Element.Name: Consignee party identifier
Element.Description: The receiving party identifier.

Element.Name: Party name
Element.Description: The name of the Delivery Customer Party.

Element.Name: Name of the Consignee
Element.Description: The Name of the Consignee.

Element.Name: Postal address
Element.Description: Postal address of the consignee

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Address line 3
Element.Description: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Party tax scheme
Element.Description: The tax information about the Delivery Party.

Element.Name: Company ID
Element.Description: The Delivery Party Value Added Tax identifer.

Element.Name: Tax scheme identifier
Element.Description: Tax scheme identifier. E.g. "VAT" or "GST".

Element.Name: Consignee party name
Element.Description: The name of the receiving party.

Element.Name: Delivery customers parties legal registration name
Element.Description: The official name of the party as registered with the relevant fiscal authority.

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: The identification scheme identifier of the despatch customer legal registration identifier

Element.Name: City name
Element.Description: The name of the city.

Element.Name: Contry
Element.Description: The residens country for the delivery customer party.

Element.Name: Contact
Element.Description: The contact of the Delivery Customer party.

Element.Name: Contact name
Element.Description: The contact name.

Element.Name: Contact email telephone
Element.Description: The phone number of the contact.

Element.Name: Contact email address
Element.Description: The electronic mail of the contact.

Element.Name: Despatching party information
Element.Description: The Despatch Party is the person or organization who provides (despatch) the goods or services. It also defines the receiver of the Receipt Advice. The role is carried out by the supplier or on behalf of the supplier.

Element.Name: Despatch party electronic address
Element.Description: Identifies the despatch party's electronic address

Element.Name: Despatching party identifier
Element.Description: The identifier of the despatching party

Element.Name: Party Name
Element.Description: The name of the Despatch Supplier Party.

Element.Name: Name of the Consignor
Element.Description: The name of the Despatch Supplier.

Element.Name: Postal address
Element.Description: Postal address of the depatching party

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Address line 3
Element.Description: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Party tax scheme
Element.Description: The tax information about the Despatch Party.

Element.Name: Company ID
Element.Description: The Despatch Party Value Added Tax identifer.

Element.Name: Tax scheme identifier
Element.Description: Tax scheme identifier. E.g. "VAT" or "GST".

Element.Name: Dispatching party name
Element.Description: The name of the dispatching party

Element.Name: Despatch supplier parties legal registration name
Element.Description: The official name of the party as registered with the relevant fiscal authority.

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: The identification scheme identifier of the despatch supplier legal registration identifier

Element.Name: City name
Element.Description: The name of the city.

Element.Name: Contry
Element.Description: The residens country for the despatch party.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: Country Code

Element.Name: Contact
Element.Description: The contact of the Despatch supplier party.

Element.Name: Contact name
Element.Description: The contact name.

Element.Name: Contact email telephone
Element.Description: The phone number of the contact.

Element.Name: Contact email address
Element.Description: The electronic mail of the contact.

Element.Name: Buyer
Element.Description: The buyer is the legal person or organization who buys or purchases the goods or services. The role is carried out by the customer or on behalf of the customer.

Element.Name: Buying party identifier
Element.Description: The buying party identifier

Element.Name: Buying party name
Element.Description: The name of the buying party

Element.Name: Postal address
Element.Description: Postal address of the customer

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Address line 3
Element.Description: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Seller
Element.Description: The seller is the legal person or organization who sells goods or services to the customer. The role is carried out by the supplier or on behalf of the supplier.

Element.Name: Selling party identifier
Element.Description: An identifier for the seller party.

Element.Name: Selling party name
Element.Description: The seller party name.

Element.Name: Postal address
Element.Description: Postal address of the supplier

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Address line 3
Element.Description: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Shipment information
Element.Description: Use the Shipment group only when the Receipt Advice is used as a response to a received shipment.

Element.Name: Shipment identifier
Element.Description: Identifies a shipment. Freight forwarder's reference number.

Element.Name: Shipment description
Element.Description: Information from Goods receiver to Supplier.

Element.Name: Consignment identifier
Element.Description: Use a dummy value since this element is mandatory.

Element.Name: Status
Element.Description: To report the status of the received consignment.

Element.Name: Condition Code
Element.Description: Specifies the status condition of the consignment.

Element.Name: Status Reason Code
Element.Description: The reason for this status condition or position, expressed as a code.

Element.Name: Status Reason Code
Element.Description: The reason for this status condition or position, expressed as a text.

Element.Name: Party identification
Element.Description: This party defines the company providing the transport service

Element.Name: Carrying party identifier
Element.Description: Identifies the Carrier party.

Element.Name: Carrier name
Element.Description: The name of the carrier that handles the delivery of the dispatched shipment.

Element.Name: Driver information
Element.Description: Identification about the driver of the vehicle that delivers the despatched shipment.

Element.Name: Driver identification document type
Element.Description: The type of document used for identifying the driver, expressed in text.

Element.Name: Actual Delivery Date
Element.Description: The Date the goods or service was delivered.

Element.Name: Actual Delivery Time
Element.Description: The time on which the supply of goods or services was made or completed according to the delivery term. Format = "hh:mm:ss+timezone". Timezone is optional to use. If omitted, the local timezone where the delivery was made should be assumed.

Element.Name: Delivery terms
Element.Description: Delivery terms code (Inco terms).

Element.Name: Special terms
Element.Description: Special delivery terms that exceeds the inco terms.

Element.Name: Delivery terms location
Element.Description: Delivery terms location. The location to which the delivery terms refer. Used to qualify the delivery terms e.g. "Terms of delivery are FOB Rotterdam"

Element.Name: Transport handling unit
Element.Description: Used to specify how the goods is marked and if there are any damages. If this group is used, all Transport Handling Units in the Advanced Despatch Advice must be included, not just some.

Element.Name: Identifier transport handling unit
Element.Description: The SSCC identification code of this Transport Handling Unit.

Element.Name: Transport Handling Unit type code
Element.Description: Type of Transport Handling Unit. Use UN/ECE Recommendation 21.

Element.Name: Damage Remark
Element.Description: A textual description of the damage on this TransportHandlingUnit.
Element.Value: Pallet cover broken, see attached photo.

Element.Name: Status of the Transport Handling Unit.
Element.Description: To report if there are any claims related to this Transport Handling Unit. If omitted, default is that the THU is received ok and with no damage or claim related to it.

Element.Name: ConditionCode
Element.Description: A code describing the status of the TransportHandlingUnit.

Element.Name: Receipt Line
Element.Description: A line detailing a kind of item received.

Element.Name: Line identity
Element.Description: A unique identity on this line, normally an increasing sequence number.

Element.Name: Note
Element.Description: Text conveying information that is not contained explicitly in other structures.

Element.Name: Received quantity
Element.Description: The total quantity received, including any rejected parts.

Attribute.Name: Quantity unit of measure
Attribute.Description: The unit of measure that applies to the quantity.

Element.Name: Short quantity
Element.Description: The quantity received short; the difference between the quantity reported despatched and the quantity actually received.

Attribute.Name: Quantity unit of measure
Attribute.Description: The unit of measure that applies to the quantity.

Element.Name: Shortage Action Code
Element.Description: A code signifying the action that the delivery party wishes the despatch party to take as the result of a shortage.

Element.Name: Rejected quantity
Element.Description: The quantity rejected due to damage, quality issues or any other cause.

Attribute.Name: Quantity unit of measure
Attribute.Description: The unit of measure that applies to the quantity.

Element.Name: Reject Reason Code
Element.Description: The reason for a rejection, expressed as a code.

Element.Name: Reject Reason
Element.Description: The reason for a rejection, expressed as text.

Element.Name: Reject Action Code
Element.Description: A code signifying the action that the delivery party wishes the despatch party to take as the result of a rejection.

Element.Name: Oversupply Quantity
Element.Description: The quantity over-supplied, i.e., the quantity over and above the quantity ordered.

Attribute.Name: Quantity unit of measure
Attribute.Description: The unit of measure that applies to the quantity.

Element.Name: Orderline Reference
Element.Description: A reference to the order line associated with this receipt line.

Element.Name: Line ID
Element.Description: The Orderline this Responseline refers to.

Element.Name: Sales order line number
Element.Description: Reference to the sellers orderline number.

Element.Name: Order reference
Element.Description: The order can be referred to at header level or here. Doing it here at line level it is possible to refer to multiple order in one document.

Element.Name: Order number
Element.Description: The order number referred to.

Element.Name: Sales order number
Element.Description: Reference to the sellers order number.

Element.Name: Despatch line Reference
Element.Description: A reference to a despatch line associated with this receipt line.

Element.Name: Line ID
Element.Description: The identity of the Despatch Advice line number referred to.

Element.Name: Item.
Element.Description: Information to describe and identify the item.

Element.Name: Name
Element.Description: The name of the item.

Element.Name: Buyer's item Identification.
Element.Description: The identity on the item assigned by the buyer.

Element.Name: Item identity
Element.Description: The buyer's identity on the item.

Element.Name: Seller's item Identification.
Element.Description: The identity on the item assigned by the seller.

Element.Name: Item identity
Element.Description: The seller's identity on the item.

Element.Name: Manufacturers item identification
Element.Description: Identifying information for this item, assigned by the manufacturer.

Element.Name: Manufacturers item identifier
Element.Description: Manufacturers article number

Element.Name: Standard Item Identification
Element.Description: A standardized item number. Only one StandardItemIdentification can be used per line.

Element.Name: Standard Item number
Element.Description: Global Trade Item Number (GTIN) or other standardized identification.

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: The scheme identifier of the Item standard identifier.

Element.Name: Item standard extended identifier.
Element.Description: With specific properties, e.g., Item 123 = Chair / Item 123 Ext 45 = brown chair.
